p: Fisetin has also been studied as an anti-diabetic. In an in vitro model of experimental diabetes, oral administration of fisetin (10Â mg/kg) reduced blood glucose and glycosylated hemoglobin levels, while the plasma insulin level was increased. This flavonoid also lead to a decrease of mRNA and expression levels of gluconeogenic genes (phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase, glucose-6-phosphatase) ( Prasath et al., 2014). The favorable effects of gluconeogenesis inhibition in the liver by fisetin are of relevance for the antidiabetic effects of both C. coggygria and T. vernicifluum.
